intro: Hieracium platysemum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are broadly ovate with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium platysemum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
